articles.title: NASA Updates Astronaut Assignments for Boeing Starliner Test Flight - NASA
articles.description: NASA will fly two astronaut test pilots aboard the agency’s Boeing Crew Flight Test (CFT) mission to the International Space Station, where they will live and work off the Earth for about two weeks.

articles.author: Fiona Jackson
articles.title: Gallstone from a mummified 16th century prince used to reconstruct the ancient genome of E. coli - Daily Mail
articles.description: Scientists from McMaster University have managed to reconstruct the genome of E. Coli using the 400-year-old gallstones of a mummified Italian prince. The genome shows how the superbug has evolved.
articles.content:
When you think about precious crown jewels, a 400-year-old gallstone is probably not what springs to mind!

articles.author: Adam Smith
articles.title: Astronomers find a new planetary system close to Earth and are ‘optimistic’ there will be habitable worlds - The Independent
articles.description: The star is only 33 light-years from our own planet, although the two worlds discovered so far are too hot to live on
articles.content:
Astronomers have found a new multiplanetary system just 33 light-years from our own planet.
The system, now the closest known one to Earth, has two terrestrial planets orbiting a cool M-dwarf star, … [+3035 chars]

articles.title: Unexplainable podcast: 7 solar system mysteries scientists haven’t solved yet - Vox.com
articles.description: Why is our moon so weird? Was there ever life on Mars? Big cosmic questions lurk in our celestial backyard.
articles.content:

articles.author: Ian Randall
articles.title: Antarctica horror: Bones discovered at ‘Doomsday glacier' paint ‘disastrous’ picture - Express
articles.description: TWO MAJOR glaciers in the West Antarctic Ice Sheet are losing ice at their fastest rate in 5,500 years, an analysis of bones taken from ancient beaches has found.

articles.description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the sequential assembly of the CMG replicative helicase on a chromatinized origin of replication provide insights into the mechanism through which DNA melting is initiated by ATP binding.
